Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bot, Human 

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player is extended by both bot and human. It has a hand and tricks.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Player constructor creates a new player with default name, hand, tricks taken, and tricks bid.
      Player(java.lang.String n)
      player constructor creates a new player with a specified name, but default hand, tricks taken, and tricks bid.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Hand getHand()
      Gets the hand of cards for the player
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the player
      int getTricksBid()
      Gets the player's number of tricks bid
      int getTricksTaken()
      Gets the player's number of tricks won
      boolean getTurnToPlay()
      Checks to see if it is this player's turn to play.
      void incrementTricksTaken()
      Adds one to the number of tricks taken.
      void setHand(Hand hand)
      Sets the hand of the player
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the player's name
      void setTricksBid()
      Sets the number of tricks bid, based on number of spades.
      void setTricksTaken(int tricksTaken)
      Sets the number of tricks taken by this player.
      void setTurnToPlay(boolean turn)
      Sets the player's turn to play

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
